educational_objective: Identify erythema nodosum as a manifestation of inflammatory bowel disease.
question_text: A 35-year-old man with Crohn disease develops the tender skin findings shown.
question_stem: Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
critique: The most likely diagnosis is erythema nodosum (Option A), a common dermatologic manifestation of inflammatory bowel disease (IBD). Erythema nodosum most commonly presents as a single or multiple tender, erythematous nodules on extensor surfaces of the lower extremities, as in this case. Other conditions associated with erythema nodosum include streptococcal infection, sarcoidosis, and pregnancy. Medications, such as oral contraceptives, may also cause erythema nodosum. In patients with IBD, erythema nodosum symptomatology typically parallels IBD disease activity; lesions usually resolve with IBD treatment.
